text: David Lee Marks (born August 22, 1948) is an American singer and guitarist. He was an early member of The Beach Boys. Marks joined the Beach Boys in February 1962. He performed on the band's first four albums, Surfin' Safari (1962), Surfin' U.S.A. (1963), Surfer Girl (1963), and Little Deuce Coupe (1963). In August 1963, he left the group. Afterward, Marks worked with acts including Casey Kasem's Band Without a Name, the Moon, Delaney & Bonnie, Colours, and Warren Zevon, and studied jazz and classical guitar at the Berklee College of Music and the New England Conservatory. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:American rock singers Category:American rock guitarists Category:American pop singers Category:American pop musicians Category:Musicians from Los Angeles Category:Singers from Los Angeles
title: David Marks
